Reviews.Title: “Great staff.”
Reviews.Author: Mary R
Reviews.Content: Hotel was fine. Very convenient location. After I got home, I realized I had left a favorite pair of shoes in the room. Called hotel with not much hope. Noah answered and said he thought he had seen them in lost and found and he would check and call me back. He did call back and said he had the shoes and would mail them back to me! Received shoes today. Thanks, Noah, great job! Also, around 12.30 am a loud party broke out in the room next door. Called front desk. Security guard was at party in literally 2 minutes and ejected those who did not belong in room. Quiet ensued. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: charlotte D
Reviews.Content: I stay in Boston with my daughter to attend the Boston Childrens Hospital. This is not only the most convenient, McDonalds IN the hotel, but they have a great staff. Jose is the highlght for my daughter. His big smile is a great thing to see when we have to be away from home for so long. We look forward to seeing Angel at the desk during the day, and Jenne in the evening! She knows where to get REAL alfredo sauce on REAL handmade macoroni! It is nice to be recognized 200 miles from home. We always enjoy our stay as well as the incredible staff. The same people everytime makes a big difference. They must really like where they work. Thank You for all your outstanding service, see you in 3 days!

Reviews.Title: “Refurbished older hotel. OK. No perks. Cheapest room found.”
Reviews.Author: njskiiier
Reviews.Content: Paid "internet lowest rate" with no option for cancellation. Checked in around 5 gave my Best Western club member. Was given an older style room with rusty locks and windows that did not lock so stayed opened 2 inches, both window. Street very noisy. hooks on wall from picture that was no longer there. Called and said was not happy with room. Sent up a dishelveld man to fix window. He basically came in and said don't worry, it will give you fresh air and nobody could get in it was only a few inches. After he left called and asked for new room. Was given a room up a floor and on other side of building , less noise and windows shut. Overall, good budget room. No extras or perks. Beds hard, pillows good. Clean rooms. Front staff friendly and helpful. No gym. No hot beverages in reception rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service!”
Reviews.Author: Michael M
Reviews.Content: I accidentally left some important documents in my room on a recent visit. Noah from the Housekeeping Department retrieved the documents and arranged to send them to me. He went beyond the call of duty and I am very grateful.

Reviews.Title: “boston hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a cheaprooms.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great location for someone with family in one of the hospitals in close proximity. Would have liked it to have included continental breakfast for the price of just sleeping there. But saved on the driving and traffic of Boston!

Reviews.Title: “Great weekend”
Reviews.Author: Niedker
Reviews.Content: We went to Boston for a long weekend and certainly enjoyed our visit. The hotel was close to the T which allowed us to go to a lot of activities and events in the city. One of the staff members even flagged down a cab for us on a cold winter's night. The room was very clean and comfortable. Being in a nice comfortable place made this a stress-free weekend. We would certainly go back.

Reviews.Title: “great place, great location”
Reviews.Author: caleb31
Reviews.Content: spent a weekend in Boston with friends and this hotel was recommended; staff was friendly and helpful; rooms were clean and pleasant; nice to park my car without costing an arm and leg while being close to the T for getting around Boston..enjoyed my room service breakfast; great neighborhood with fun places all within walking distance....will stay here again... caleb31

Reviews.Title: “A Diamond in the Rough”
Reviews.Author: Prof-Sawdust
Reviews.Content: This trip was for medical reasons [visits and treatments at DFCI and BWH] . My wife and I spent two weeks at the hotel and really impressed by the staffs of the hotel, the grill and the adjecent parking garage. During our first weeks stay I requested the same room for our second week [went home for the weekend]. The satff went out of their way to ensure that we would get the same room [8th floor facing Longwood Ave.]. It was comfortable and quiet. During our stay they upgraded our king sized matress. It was done in a way that would not be any inconvenience to us. While there aren't a lot of restaurants in the immediate area, we did make use of the Longwood Grille [Free continental breakfast and a 15% discount at dinner]. There was a Bertuccis Italian restaurant a short walk from the hotel that we utilized as well. We required the use of a portable refrigerator and one was delivered almost immediately for a nominal fee. All in all, it was perfect for my wife and I. We are familiar with the mass transit system and visited several places when she felt strong enough. We will require several overnights in the near future and hope to be able to stay at the hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “What a gem of a Place to stay if you are in need of a hotel near the hospitals, Fenway Park or Jamaica Plain.”
Reviews.Author: 8nqDh62V
Reviews.Content: I lived in Boston for 10 years and never noticed this hotel. I was in town visiting family and thought I would give it a try. What a totally pleasant experience. The hotel is clean, well cared for and managed. It's proximity to area attractions is great and the adjoining food court and restaurants and stores in the Galleria is wonderful. Plus you can access from the hotel mezzanine area that opens into the Galleria. My only gripe is the HVAC system. This hotel still uses window unit right next to my bed in my case. The temp regulation was difficult and the noise and hot air blowing on me were not welcome. But that is my only complaint I loved my 3 night stay there and would return again if in the area without question.

Reviews.Title: “As always a very good stay!”
Reviews.Author: butterfieldmk
Reviews.Content: I love this place for a few reasons: 1) The staff is very helpful and friendly 2) They have a parking garage with a very fair rate where you can leave your car for your stay as cabs and T-stations are both easily reached 3) If you are going to Fenway this place is awesome because it's only a few blocks from there. About 5 minutes by foot from the hotel And if nothing else, if you get hit by a car crossing the street this place is surrounded by hospitals. I will be honest in saying that if you are a couple looking for a romantic weekend away or something like that it probably would not be the first place I would recommend, but if you are just looking for a nice place to stay to travel as a family, visit someone in the hospital or hit Fenway for a game, this place is reasonably priced (for Boston) and a nice find! I will continue to stay here whenever I travel to the Boston area, thanks for another great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Not bad but not great”
Reviews.Author: Dave7475
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights on business. I chose this hotel as it was close to the hospital I was visiting. The hotel itself is a little dated, it's clean but dated. Pros: Free Wifi Clean Room No street noise (atleast not in my room anyway) Close to T-stop Cons: No in room safes and the one at reception is tiny (can't store iPad or Laptop there) Restaurant food is only OK If I were back visiting the hospital again I'd probably still stay here as it's convenient and clean but other than that I wouldn't.

Reviews.Title: “Reservation Process”
Reviews.Author: Alethea V
Reviews.Content: I have stayed there before and It was great when you need to be close to Beth Israel or Boston Children's Medical. Staff is very Friendly especially Jose the Bell/ Travel person. However, the reason for this post is that I need to return with my Dad who has Alzheimers and I needed a room on the same, floor. Noah, the reservation agent listened to what I was saying and even though I say this all the time I travel, I did not expect he responce I got. He validated my concern and said he would make sure that we had ajoining rooms so that I did not need to worry. It was a great expirience and I feel Noah went out of his way to make sure I was safe and my Dad would be safe as well. I would highly recommmend this hotel to anyone. I feel comfortable there and the satff is truly genuine and unique. Cheers

Reviews.Title: “Return of Lost Items”
Reviews.Author: Anja Z
Reviews.Content: I was pleased with the accommodations, but the real reason I rated this hotel excellent was because I forgot some jewelry in my room and they handled it so professionally. The items were turned in to the housekeeping supervisor and I was called promptly. The items were then shipped overnight to my house. I couldn't be happier with the experience.

Reviews.Title: “Harvard Public Health”
Reviews.Author: Spoty_USA
Reviews.Content: This hotel met all my needs few blocks away from Harvard medical facilities, free internet, direct floor connection to food court with good prices and selection. The most beneficial part of the food court was having a CVS for bottle water. Easy walk to public transport to downtown Boston. The Hotel was very concerned with hygiene being that (I think) most people that stay here are visiting one of the many medical facilities close by. Will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Not great”
Reviews.Author: zheb
Reviews.Content: I think that the Best Western is so complacent that they are the hotel the closest to Children's Hospital Boston that they feel they can charge outrageous rates for what they are offering. It's an OK hotel, but really not worth the money. But if you are going to the hospital, this is the easiest place to stay. Otherwise the rooms are small and dark, outdated and rather unappealing. Staff is nice, but I wouldn't say exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “It's all about the staff!”
Reviews.Author: ELAINE A
Reviews.Content: When a crisis hits, you can use all of the care and compassion you can get. The Inn at Longwood Medical has come to the rescue. Clean accomodations, great restaurant, convenient location, and most of all, the staff. David Gore, assistant front office manager, has exceeded our expectations in many ways. Talk about going out of the way to ease our pain, but providing the accomodations we need on short notice, promptly returning calls and e-mails without ever making us feel like we are a burdon, what an asset to Best Western. Being 5 hours away from the crisis, and traveling exhausted, he somehow sports a personality that can cure it all. Cudos to him! Incidentally, don't forget Antonio Gomez. Another truely valued employee, helpful, pleasant, witty, and again, makes us just feel like we are among friends when we stay with them. I hope we are NEVER in this situation again, but if I am, OR when, and if we ever travel again, we will make it a point to seek out a Best Western to stay in. Especially if they employ more employees like David Gore and Antonio Gomez. Thanks mucho!! Elaine and Armand Allegrucci

Reviews.Title: “Good location for hospital business”
Reviews.Author: Rod M
Reviews.Content: If you are doing business with any of the nearby medical facilities, the Inn at Longwood is right in the middle of it all. Everything is well within walking distance of the hotel. The rooms were comfortable and the staff was very helpfull in recieving packages on several occasions that I needed for my work with one of the hospitals. I will stay there again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: hanskitchens
Reviews.Content: We stay here regularly as we spent quite a bit of time at Children's Hospital. The hotel is very conveniently located next door to the hospital entrance. The rooms are small, but clean. The staff are helpful. Free wifi worked perfectly from our room. There is a food court & attached restaurant which makes it even more convenient. There are many restaurants within walking distance as well as Fenway Park. If you have to visit or stay at any on the Longwood area hospitals, this is a very good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel!”
Reviews.Author: jend953b
Reviews.Content: I just spent 6 nights at the Inn at Longwood, from Oct. 16 thru 21st. As it is located next to Children's, Dana Farber, and other hospitals, many guests are family of patients undergoing care in the neighboring facilities. The hotel staff, from housekeeping to the restaurant go out of their way to make life easier during trying times. Rooms are especially clean and comfortable. I agree with a previous reviewer who mentioned that some more available channels on the tv would be nice. Special thanks to Angel, the desk manager who arranged for me to stay 3 additional nights. The Inn at Longwood is a special place!

Reviews.Title: “Attentive to needs and considerate”
Reviews.Author: jconway15
Reviews.Content: I spent the last month (5 days a week & weekends) staying at the Longwood as my wife underwent a bone marrow transplant at Dana Farber/Brigham & Womens Hospital. I have to extend a huge Thank You to all the staff and managers for the way they made my stay both comfortable and at ease. With my changing schedules they were extremely flexible and attentive to all my needs during what could of been a very stressful time. Everyone from the desk folks, room service, the restarurant staff, and housekeeping saw to it that my stay was as close to being home as possible. The rooms were spotless and comfortable. When I needed to juggle things they made it seamless. I would recommend the Longwood to anyone Staying in Boston whether if fot 1 night or an extended stay. You can spend much more at more expensive hotels but why would you want too. If you need a place in the Longwood Medical area this is it.

Reviews.Title: “Decor a bit dated but still OK....”
Reviews.Author: Rosenblums4
Reviews.Content: There are plenty of posh hotels in Boston. This isn't one of them. But it is very convenient If you are visiting any of the colleges of Fenway ( Emmanuel College, Massachusetts College of Art and Design, Massachusetts College of Pharmacy and Health Sciences, Simmons College, Wentworth Institute of Technology and Wheelock College) Overnight indoor parking available for $18. If room service or hotel restaurant grub is not your thing, there is an adjacent indoor food court attached. Getting your morning. Dunkin' Donuts in your slippers is in my opinion a really good thing! Also, Subway, Sushi/Hibachi, McDonalds and a really nice guy making fresh breakfast burritos at Beantown Burrito. Our room was small but very clean. The bathroom door didn't close and the A/C was loud but there was a big flat screen TV and the bed was comfy. For our short visit the convenience and location more than made up for any shortcomings.

Reviews.Title: “If you are here for CHB then this is a great location”
Reviews.Author: SJB1209
Reviews.Content: I donâ€™t think you get a great hotel but they are extremely convenient if you are visiting the Childrenâ€™s hospital - if you call them by phone they will also do a CHB rate. Room came with a fridge, microwave and crib. There was also a small desk and table with two chairs. Not much space left but the rooms were clean and the housekeeping service seemed good. We did not need to use the main desk but they checked us in and out promptly. The food court is literally through a door on the bottom floor and also had a medium sized CVS. There is free wireless internet throughout the hotel and a printer that you can use next to the check in desk. There is a good pizza place two minutes away called Butucciâ€™s.

Reviews.Title: “if you are going to brigham and women's hospital, book here.”
Reviews.Author: lovecrepes
Reviews.Content: we stayed for 1 night at this conveniently located best western hotel and were pleasantly surprised. when i booked the room, i had asked to be away from an elevator, ice machine, and noise from the 1st floor food court, and was satisfied on all 3 counts. the windows opened about 1/2 an inch, just enough to get air along with street noise, but we were, after all, in a city and near a major medical facility. we enjoyed firm comfy beds with plenty of pillows, an ensuite bathroom with many towels, and a small microwave and frig. we would return.

Reviews.Title: “Best Reservations Service”
Reviews.Author: Mary B
Reviews.Content: I just booked a room at this hotel. I needed a room for a very busy weekend in Boston (Parent Weekend at the colleges). I have stayed at this hotel before and LOVE it! It is convenient to the Mass Pharmacology College (walking distance), the rooms are very clean, and the service is excellent. Tonight I was searching for a room on their website, but there were no vacancies. So I called the hotel directly and spoke with a wonderful guy named Noah in the reservations office. Noah found me a room and at a fantastic price. He also told me about other ways of saving money in the future when I stay at this great hotel again. Thank you Noah. You are awesome and a great representative for Best Western!

Reviews.Title: “Making Reservations”
Reviews.Author: debrapt
Reviews.Content: I just called this hotel and had the best experience ever making reservations for my son's college graduaton next spring! Noah handled my call and was extremely courteous, friendly and efficient! I am looking forward to my stay there and will be touching base with Noah prior to my visit for suggestions on dinner reservations!

Reviews.Title: “Noah-very helpful!”
Reviews.Author: Debbie I
Reviews.Content: I had made a reservation online and did not realize that because we are coming for a medical visit we could get a discount. So I called and thankfully Noah answered,and from other reviews I read I knew he was the guy I needed to talk to. He was very pleasant, helpful and very friendly.In a matter of minutes he adjusted my reservation and I am looking forward to meeting him in person!

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleased”
Reviews.Author: outbax
Reviews.Content: Yes, the price is shocking but you will find it is fair market value for anything else in the area. We stayed to attend a game at Fenway which is an easy one mile walk away. Check-in was very welcoming and efficient. Checked in at 2PM and provided a room right away, people next to us were not as fortunate. Next day, saw people checking in at 10AM so you can be sure an honest effort will be made to check you in as early as possible. Received room 501 which is not a room i recommend due to its view of the generators below and being next to a 40 person meeting suite. Room was very clean, comfortable and full of ammenities with a pleasing decor. Bathroom is not fancy and hot water takes a little while but it is clean and comfortbale for its purpose. Beds are very comfortable and flat screen tv is nice for viewing. Room has coffee, desk and table with two chairs. Not large but comfortable. Hallway had a lot of dust debris that was still there in the morning from maintenance changing ceiling tiles. Would have thought they would rin a vaccuum through after doing the work. A ladder was also left overnight in the hallway. Walls are thin as heard a lot of banging in the next door room. Checking out was also very pleasant and efficient. Special mention to a parking attendant in the parking lot who provided great assistance in finding a parking spot in a very busy lot. Parking is $18 which is a good discount off regular rates. In summary, a comfortable hotel with very good customer service. Recommend a room on higher floors.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING Guy NOAH”
Reviews.Author: mypi32880
Reviews.Content: Called a number of hotels even called Best Western 3x. The 4th try I just wanted to settle for any dates they had available. Noah was his name and he worked magic to get me 2 rooms for all the dates needed to make our stay a miracle while our family member was getting surgery. He made it possible to stay at 1 hotel rather than moving from hotel to hotel. He was great and so pleasant that even at this rough time he made it possible for our family to feel welcomed.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't Keep Reservation - Suggested My Kids Sleep on the Floor”
Reviews.Author: LV2PHSH
Reviews.Content: I made a reservation here for my family of four and was guaranteed for late arrival. When we arrived at the hotel around 9:45pm, we were told that the only room available was a king room, with one king bed. When pressed for other options, the desk attendant was able to get a room with two beds for us. We waited for over 1/2 hour for the room. However, when we got to that room, it had a double bed and a single bed -- again insufficient for a family of four. The first reaction of the desk attendant was to give us an extra set of sheets so my kid could sleep on the floor. I pressed them hard to give me a the king room as well, so that each of us could have a bed (not an unreasonable request given that the only function of a hotel is to provide beds for their guests!). They acted as though not charging me for the second room was a gracious gesture on their part and offered no compensation for the inconvenience/errors. Rooms are fair, and the parking garage is a nightmare. Service - lousey. You may find this to be a nit-picky review, but hotels are in a service industry, and lousy service = lousy

Reviews.Title: “Served it's purpose”
Reviews.Author: MomCPNP
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four nights while our daughter had surgery at childrens hospital. The hotel was nice but way overpriced. The room was spacious and adequate. I was charged 10 dollars extra a day for a rickety old fridge. I needed it for medical reasons and told them so. They replied that it was their policy to charge for the fridge even if it was for medicine!! No other hotels have ever charged for a refrigerator ever!! Next to some world premier hospitals to boot!!!

Reviews.Title: “Forgot some clothes!”
Reviews.Author: SBS78
Reviews.Content: I forgot a small bag of clothes in the room. I phoned the hotel to have housekeeping look for it. Noah Gopin, the Housekeeping Supervisor went out of his way to be helpful. He personally entered the room and found the bag exactly where I told him it would be. He then sent it out to me. I have left things behind in rooms before regretfully. Most of them have never been seen again. Luckily for me, Noah persevered and found my items. I am very happy and very thankful for his effort.

Reviews.Title: “great home away from home”
Reviews.Author: Susan H
Reviews.Content: This is a great value, and the location is perfect if you need to be in the heart of the medical center, get to Fenway, or have a central spot for the family to go the many wonderful directions touristing / college shopping in Boston. The staff were very warm and accomodating and the Galleria being attached made food and all the little things from the CVS so convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: bradleyl_11
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in July primarily because it was close to Fenway. Not a bad hotel, just not as nice as what you would expect for the money. Biggest plus is that it's about a 15 minute walk to Fenway. Food court is also a nice bonus. Parking ($18 a day in garage) was tough when we were there due to construction in the garage. Numerous cars were double-parked every day. Parking staff did the best they could under the circumstances. Longwood Grille, part of the hotel, was very unimpressive for breakfast buffet. Staff there didn't seem to care much at all. Front desk staff was better.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but bit expensive for the quality offered.”
Reviews.Author: JustAddWater
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at BW Plus Boston - The Inn at Longwood Medical for two nights. The room was clean and the service was ok. Being in the vicinity of many hospitals, ambulances are a major problem if you are a light sleeper. Also try to have a room on higher floors as our room at the 6th floor had constant noise from the shopping mall/food court ventilation fan until those premises are closed. The rooms have free wireless internet which is the only good thing about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service!”
Reviews.Author: RoldGold55
Reviews.Content: The hotel room that we statying in was very clean and quiet. Giselle was very helpful when we needed to change our room from a single queen bed to a double queen bed. She worked very hard to find us the room and got us into it as soon as she could. Great continental breakfast in the morning as well.

Reviews.Title: “superior responsiveness”
Reviews.Author: ebgreene1
Reviews.Content: great job by noah gopin, housekeeping supervisor , in finding and returning a lost valuable cell phone. he had to track me down on the road and stuck to it until he got the phone back to me. super.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Staff”
Reviews.Author: lewmjbo
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Best Western -The Inn at Longwood in Boston because we had a family member in the hospital. It was very convient location ,close to the hospitals and easy access to public transportation. The hotel was clean. The restaurant was above average for dining, but the thing that impressed us most was the friendliness and helpfulness of all the staff we came in contact with..concierge,front desk,housekeeping and restaurant staff. Everyone was pleasant, made you feel welcome and was prompt to fill any request....Great job.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: LN87
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a recent trip to Boston for RedSox game. Loved it. Clean, great service, great air, good sleep. Very happy with this hotel. Short walk to Fenway.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, but not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: boartsy
Reviews.Content: Our main reason for staying here was to be within walking distance of Fenway Park. That, and having access to a food court connected to the hotel, were the plusses. For the negatives, if you want a microwave or refrigerator, you must request these and are charged for them. Hotel description stated a daily newspaper would be delivered to our door every morning --- never received one. When we checked in, we received two complimentary meal coupons for the breakfast buffet at the restaurant located inside the hotel. However, only one of us went the following morning, but the restaurant would not allow us to keep the unused coupon for the following morning. The only parking is in the attached parking garage. If you park there, the hotel will charge you a "discount" rate of $18 per day. There is a computer and printer in the lobby that was available for printing our tickets at no cost. The female receptionist was very pleasant when we checked in, but when we checked out the male receptionist didn't even say thank you. I just felt that since a lot of people probably stay here to be close to the hospitals, they would try to accomodate guests more by even supplying refrigerators/microwaves free of charge. Little things mean a lot.

Reviews.Title: “Great visit and GREAT service!”
Reviews.Author: magmom02
Reviews.Content: We recently went to the Boston area to visit a friend at Brigham and Women's Hospital. We chose the hotel due to its close proximity to the hospital. When we arrived we were able to check in early. We were pleased to find a clean room with very comfortable beds and the air on! We were traveling with our 9 and 5 year old so having the food court attached was great and convenient. The walk to the T was 5 min and we were able to go to Quincy Market, Children's Museum and the Aquarium. We ordered room service for dessert and the kids were thrilled with their ice cream sundaes! After leaving we realized that we had left my daughter's teddy bear (her only true prized possesion that she has had for over 7 years). She was devestated and when we called at 9pm the staff checked the lost and found and the housecleaning carts and they didn't find anything. The next morning after we had arrived home, Noah called us with the great news that he checked with the housekeeper that had cleaned our room and he had our bear!!!! He had it in the mail and it was in my daughter's arms in 2 days. THANK YOU NOAH!!!!!!! Overall, we had a delightful visit to Boston. We loved the location of the hotel and would be happy to return!

Reviews.Title: “Awful”
Reviews.Author: mimi34marg
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Inn at Longwood in for one night this June for a conference. The front desk staff were unhelpful, unfriendly and very slow (Terrance I believe was his name - but the woman who checked me out was equally unfriendly and surly. When I got to my room, the desk chair had the seat cushion detached with the screws taken out of it and was sitting on top on the desk. The bathroom had a used soap bar in it. The rooms are also noisy, but that's to be expected given the location. The bed was very firm, so if you like a rock hard bet, you'll be happy. I would NOT recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff - terrible bed”
Reviews.Author: Bluefinguy
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for a college trip for our daughter. The hotel was in an excellent location and very convenient to get around Boston. We were first met by Antonio at the front desk and found him to be engaging and an absolute pleasure to deal with. Later we dealt with Terrill and he too was very nice. The room was clean and about what we expected from the property. The problem was that the bed was about the most uncomfortable bed we have ever had in a hotel room and it made for a rather poor night of sleep. While recognizing that there can be wide variations between hotel beds this one was at the very low end of the spectrum and was, in our view, unacceptable. I see where some other reviewers commented on the comfort of the beds and note that we had a queen bed and leave open the possibility that the problem is restricted to the queen sets and everything else is fine. With our child beginning college near the hotel this fall we will be traveling to Boston and staying several times per year. While the staff is excellent and makes us want to return for our future trips, I must say that I cannot say I would do it without knowing that the problem was with that particular bed and does not represent all of them at the property.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Service”
Reviews.Author: macniven
Reviews.Content: Our daughter was rushed to the hospital next door and we needed a place to stay for an unknown period of time. The folks at the BW were exceptionally accommodating - we'd already stayed several nights, checking in and out each day - they knew our situation and even when they became booked made arrangements for us. I ended up staying six nights. I found their towels to be plush, luxurious and absorbent and wanted to use those towels in my business. I called back to the hotel a couple weeks after our stay and Noah called me back with specific information on where to find these towels - excellent service even after the stay! How could you ask for more!

Reviews.Title: “Checkbook left in room was located by Housekeeping Supervisor and promptly mailed to me!”
Reviews.Author: scsmd
Reviews.Content: When I returned home to West Virginia, I realized that my checkbook was missing. You can imagine that I was quite concerned that it would fall into the wrong hands. As it turned out it fell into the hands of Noah Gopin, the Housekeeping Supervisor, and these were the "right hands". When I called him looking for the checkbook, I was delighted and relieved that he and his staff had fouund it. He got it back to me via UPS within a couple of days. Thanks, Noah!!!

Reviews.Title: “Definitely exceeded my expectations”
Reviews.Author: stchuckmom
Reviews.Content: Hands down the top Best Western I've ever stayed in. Location was great, easily walkable to Fenway, Copley Square, Expo Center, and train stops. Front desk was nice as well as knowledgeable. Rooms were comfy too. There's also a foodcourt attached if you need a meal (McDonalds to sushi and more) or a drugstore. And the hotel restaurant I'd give three stars, plus five stars for its convenvience. Beds are low, maybe knee high at most. But much more comfortable than I expected. I was there for the marathon and they had food items out for us to grab race morning and a great little happy hour table after the race. All around a great experience at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Who knew a Best Western would be so good?”
Reviews.Author: cooper12
Reviews.Content: What a shock that this hotel could be so nice. My daughter had to stay in the hospital next door for a few days. We looked at a corporate rate a some high end hotels ( four seasons and the Ritz) but decided the closeness to the hospital was the top priority. Now I am not saying this is the Ritz but for a clean room with a comfortable bed at a good price this was great. the only complaint would be that there was a lot of street noise. this is probably standard for boston but took a little getting use to for me.

Reviews.Title: “The accommodations were wonderful, very comfortable.”
Reviews.Content: My husband was having surgery at the hospital across the street from the Best Western. The room was very clean and comfortable. Everyone was very pleasant and helpful at the hotel, since we had never been to that area of Boston before. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay”
Reviews.Author: butterfieldmk
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a Boston sports weekend I had given my friend for Christmas (Celtics, Bruins and Red Sox all in one weekend!) I choose this hotel because of their proximity to Fenway park. I couldn't have been happier! My friends I was traveling with and I had two rooms and they put us in rooms with connection doors which was great to be able to socialize! The front desk staff was AWESOME. Extremely helpful and very friendly; some of the best service I have ever received! We declined housekeeping service while staying, but the room was very clean when we arrived. I was impressed! As far as the Celtics and Bruins games go, the hotel is located about 5 or 6 blocks from a T-station stop (an easy 5 minute walk to it) and it's the inbound green line which literally stops at Boston Garden, so once you are on you can just relax until you get there. The hotel is also located less than a mile from Fenway, again, an easy walk to and from the hotel! The restaurant was just OK for food, but when I needed change for a $10 I stopped into the restaurant to see if they could help. They said they were low on change themselves and couldn't help, but one of the waiters pulled out his wallet and broke my $10 for me which I felt was going above and beyond and I was also impressed by! The only "negative" thing I would say that I didn't really like about the stay was the beds. They were very clean and well made, but I found the mattress to be a bit firmer than I prefer. However I sight this as a personal preference and not a complaint, I'm sure others enjoy a firm mattress more than me, but I slept fine on it. Just an FYI to fellow travelers! All in all I would HIGHLY recommend this hotel to anyone traveling into Boston, especially if heading to Fenway. I would stay here again without giving it a second thought. GREAT hotel!

Reviews.Title: “This hotel steps up to the plate and goes over and above”
Reviews.Author: Suem28
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Best Western during a hospitalization for my husband. This is my second stay. It is so convenient to the hospitals in the area you can walk to Beth Israel, Childrens, Joslin or Dana Farber in just minutes. It is clean and safe and the staff was very considerate all during the stay. I found it necessary to extend my stay twice and they handled it without difficulty. They provide a continental breakfast that is nicely done. They have a CVS pharmacy right downstairs along with a food court. It is safe and a great location when you have other things on your mind. I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome service”
Reviews.Author: dpnthought
Reviews.Content: I spoke with Noah on the phone and he gave me the best rate possible. All of my questions were answered in a calm, pleasant and professional manner. The customer service at this hotel is outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “The only one to choose if visiting hospitals...just a short walk away”
Reviews.Author: nancybee
Reviews.Content: I stayed here the day after a blizzard and had to visit someone in Brigham and Women's hospital about 2 blocks away. It was a very easy walk. The sidewalks were shoveled and protected. The hotel is nice. There is a food court with several fast food places adjoining the hotel - no need to even go outside. There is a restaurant in the hotel as well. Also a CVS in the food court if needed. We walked to the T (subway) about 5 blocks away to go back to the airport. Very easy even with snow on the ground and pulling suitcases...sidewalks were all cleared...and only cost $2 compared to the $45 taxi we took on arrival. Definitely stay here if you have business in any of the hospitals. There is not another hotel for at least a mile or two away; too far to walk.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel and greater location!!!!”
Reviews.Author: candy628
Reviews.Content: First time at Best Western was to see colleges. The entire staff welcomed us and made us feel very comfortable. They gave us many pointers on where to go and what to do!!! The rooms were all clean, neat , and plenty of towels. Any questions we had were quickly answered. Having the resturants downstairs(never having to leave if we didn't want to) was WONDERFUL!!! Even Dunkin Donuts and CVS were located downstairs. Again centrally located to all the sites. If you wanted to walk you could - to Fenway, musuems, etc. JUST A GREAT HOTEL!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Premium location near hospital for ill son; amazing service and amenities!”
Reviews.Author: Nana029
Reviews.Content: When faced with the need to be present for a gravely ill son, I was amazed and delighted to find that the Inn is directly across the street from the hospital, offering also garage parking. Special bonuses ( free continental breakfast; 15% off dinner at hotel) available for hospital families. We used both; food quite extraordinarily wonderful! Service from ALL hotel staff was exemplary; friendly, very forthcoming and helpful; smiling; eager to assist in any way. Room was beautiful; view of downtown Boston; all amenities; immaculate. And small touches like a nightlight as part of the provided hairdryer...We were really cherished guests and have already raved to many about the Inn at Longwood Medical. Bravo Best Western!

Reviews.Title: “Very impressed by staff”
Reviews.Author: gdagobert
Reviews.Content: Left a pair of sun glasses in my room - Called after two days and found it. Glasses were shipped to me very quickly - Thank you Mr. Tony. Very impressed with your professionalism.

Reviews.Title: “A stress-free place to wind-down before/after stressful hospital visits.”
Reviews.Author: Nunya_B_Znes
Reviews.Content: We stay here every few months when I have a checkup at Dana Farber. Hospital visits are so stressful, it is great to have a place to stay where we know we will be able to relax. Parking is easy, and we don't have to move the car to go to the hospital -- just walk down the street. Patients and their famiiies: Make sure to ask for the medical rate, and then bring some form from your doctor (such as appointment confirmation mailing) to document it. Rooms are clean -- important for the immune-suppressed -- and comfortable. Discount at the restaurant in the same building is nice, though the restaurant , while adequate, is much less attentive than the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “VERY COMFORTABLE & NEAR BRIGHAM & WOMENS HOSPITAL”
Reviews.Author: JoeandLee
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the most convenient if you need to be at any of the hospitals in the Longwood area; I needed to be near Brigham & Womens Hospital. The room was clean, adequately sized and surprised to get a King when I expected a Queen sized bed. Bathroom was adequate, although a little small. My family stayed hear for four days in Dec. 2010, while I was in surgery and felt comforable and they were very helpful with their needs.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: NEUTours
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this property while my husband was in the hospital and can not say enough about how helpful the staff was to me. The were considerate and helpful in all ways possible. My room was great, clean and comfortable. I would highly recommend this hotel for any stay in the Boston area or if you need to be in the Hospital area. They really do know how to make your stay comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and Great Service”
Reviews.Author: jarab
Reviews.Content: We stayed for the location, as we had appointments at Dana Farber next door. We were pleasantly surprised by the restaurant and had a great quick dinner. The rooms were clean as was the entire hotel. I can't say enough about the great housekeeping staff, as in our rush to leave, I left an item in the room that just cost me over $ 300. I called the hotel back over the weekend and the housekeeping supervisor returned my call on Sunday to tell me they found it and would send it back to me. I was thrilled!! I appreciated the medical discount also and plan to stay there again when we need to be in the area and looking for a place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent reservation booking experience!”
Reviews.Author: katiesma
Reviews.Content: I just booked my January 12th reservation with "Noah". He was efficient and personable. If the hotel is as good at customer service as he was, I'm looking forward to my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Reservations Service: A+”
Reviews.Author: Boatschoolboy
Reviews.Content: Reservations person couldn't have been more helpful. Very flexible in dealing with patients and their families.

Reviews.Title: “Provided a refund even after the cut off time allowed, understood a families hardships.”
Reviews.Author: BuddyF1
Reviews.Content: We were in Boston for a procedure at Childrens Hospital of Boston and made a reservation at Best Western so I could be close to my daughter and wife after the procedure and not drive the 2 hours home at night and again in the morning. We received good news after the procedure but due to the nature of a hospital and the busy schedules of doctors we were not told we could go home for the night until after the 4PM cancellation time. I called at 4:50 PM and was told by the representive after speaking to his manager that we would not be charged the night stay after cancelling late. This is greatly appreciated and finacially a great help. Best Western showed compassion and understanding to a family that is going through a hard enough time dealing with a childs illnessand not to worry about losing money to return home to the comfort of our own house. Even though I did not spend a night in this Hotel I would highly recommend it to anyone traveling to Boston for what ever reason. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: bell_1024
Reviews.Content: The inn at Longwood is the perfect place to stay when you have a loved one in one of the Medical Centers. My brother-in-law was at BGW Shapiro Cardiac Center for multiple bypass surgery that was such high risk it could not be done at a medical center in Maine. We were booked from Sunday thru Thursday but no rooms available for Thursday night. We tried each day to extend but nothing was available for Thursday night. Shortly after my call Monday night checking to extend until Tuesday of the following week due to delay in surgery, Bill called back and said I know you are from Maine and are stressed, I am going to go out of my way and extend including Thurs. It was a great releif to me because my sister (wife of patient) was elderly and wheelchair bound. You cannot ask for more than that. Our family's thanks to Bill!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, decent hotel for the Harvard Med School area”
Reviews.Author: travelclam
Reviews.Content: It's an older inn which was refurbished as a Best Western. We stayed there for 2 nights at a special conference price (the conference was at the hotel) which is still quite expensive, but we found out that in Boston any hotel in and around town are expensive. The room is clean and roomy. the staff helpful and friendly. The best feature about this hotel is that it's very well located near all the medical related firms such as Harvard Medical School, the Mass General Hospital, the Dana-Faber Cancer Institute, and the hotel is attached to the Longwood Gallaria mall which has a nice food court and a few little stores. The complaints I have are that the blankets are thin. I would have thought for a hotel which has nightly rate of ~$300 it would have a nice fluffy comforter. We are talking about Boston, a bit up north, not Miami down south where it's VERY warm. I had to take the extra blanket from the closet (and thank goodness there is one) to use. Yes, one can turn on the heat, but the heater makes noise and that doesn't help with falling asleep. The second compalint is that whoever the hotel hired to reglaze the bathtub didn't do a good job. It was one of those older style cast iron tub with porceline enamel. The enamel had chipped off quite a bit and the tub looked like it was very dirty. But it wasn't dirt, it was just the enamel came off the tub. The shower water fixture came off when I tried to turn the water on, but I was able to put it back and use the shower. I did leave my comments on the Best WEstern Guest Comment card. I hope management had taken care of the problems.

Reviews.Title: “you have to be kidding me”
Reviews.Author: 100nightsayear_sea
Reviews.Content: I was forced to stay here because the city was essentially sold out. Superficially the hotel is ok. The rroom had modern linens and a flat screen tv. However, the things that have become common at the Hampton Inns, Hilton Garden Inns and Holiday Inn Expresses are lacking here. 1. Wireless is cranky and slow. The engineering guy told me the system was installed in 2000....did they even have the internet in 2000? 2. 29 TV Channels - like Discovery Channel, out of luck. Like History Channel. Sorry. How about Sci Fi? or Food Network? Nope. Three flavors of ESPN but no CNN or MSNBC. Horrible. 3. Restaurant is terrible. Don't be fooled by the posters positioning it as a "hot" local hang out. It's a dump and the food tends towards the industrial - everything out of freezer bag.... 4. Air conditioner is weak. It's not warm here, but the AC could not cool down a stuffy room. Don't stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: stephestellar
Reviews.Content: I had a really unsatisfactory experience here. Called in advance to make sure that I could park the UHaul van I was traveling with in their lot. Asked about 11' specifically! When we arrived, it turned out that the clearance wasn't high enough, and NO ONE affiliated with the hotel could help us find a spot. Also, the room was small, the windows looked onto a stairwell, and the beds were hard. I wouldn't recommend this hotel for anyone, truly.

Reviews.Title: “Can't believe they charge over $200/night for this place!!”
Reviews.Author: peenut557
Reviews.Content: Let me preface this review with one statement: if the hotel were appropriately priced, I would have nothing bad to say about this hotel. However, since the hotel seems to think they are worth $200 per night, I feel that I must speak out about the quality for your dollar. In fact, I feel the hotel is blatantly taking advantage of the fact that there are very few hotels in the nearby area. Someone PLEASE open a nicer hotel nearby. You would gladly have my business!! I travelled to Boston on business, and as I was attending a meeting at the Harvard Medical school conference center, the Best Western at Longwood was recommended to me. Overall, my impression of this hotel is poor. The staff were very unhelpful (although the concierge was quite charming). When I had no warm water for a shower, I was told they were working on a valve and that there was no good time to do this and it had to be done. My thoughts were, "Why on EARTH would 9 am when many guests are taking their morning showers be the appropriate time?!?!" Couldn't it have waited until later in the afternoon??? Beyond that, the hotel is a bit dated and the staff misinformed. I found that I was often given wrong information concerning tour times and given wrong directions to nearby areas. Although I had no trouble with crime in the area, the doors do have rather large signs warning the guest to make sure they can see all callers at the door, which leads me to believe that they have had trouble in the past. I will mention a few pros. The hotel offers free wifi and is in an excellent location: walking distance to Fenway, Harvard medical, and the Longwood medical area. Despite these positives, I cannot in good conscience recommend this hotel to anyone. As I stated previously, if the price somehow matched the quality of my stay, I would not be complaining. I cannot see how this Best Western can justify their price. It actually ANGERS me as it appears they are taking advantage of persons who need to stay in the Longwood area for medical appointments. Since there are few other choices, I have to imagine this hotel charges a four star price for the area alone. However, it would be nice if they tried to at least live up to this four star price.

Reviews.Title: “ABOVE AND BEYOND”
Reviews.Author: ledyardbball
Reviews.Content: Bryan at the inn went above and beyond to help myself and my daughter to book a room at their hotel. Every hotel in the greater boston area is booked this weekend ! My daughter and I are coming to town to play in a u13 girls basketball tourney with no where to stay ! Bryan searched and some how fit us in for the night. i just want to say what great customer service this was ! I NOW KNOW WHERE WE WILL STAY EVERYTIME WE COME TO BOSTON !! Thanks again.

Reviews.Title: “Location is great if you are needing to be close to hospitals. Otherwise, steer clear.”
Reviews.Author: EMH3kids
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at the BW Longwood Medical location, as our teenage son had appts. at Dana-Farber and Children's Hospital. The location in relation to these establishments is excellent. So if you are visiting the area for medical care, the hotel will suffice. However, if you are visiting Boston to sightsee or visit a student at a nearby college, I would not recommend this hotel. The room seemed very run down. The bedroom floor was soaking wet over by the A/C unit. I did notify housekeeping of this when we left so hopefully it will be resolved for the next guests. The bathroom floor seemed sticky - maybe from the cleaner not being thoroughly mopped off? (that is what I am hoping!) - and there was someone else's hair stuck to the back of the bathroom door. My husband travels for business and stays in hotels 10+ nights a month and he agreed that this hotel was below standard. The gentleman who checked us in did not greet us with a "hello". He just said, "Checking in?" He ran the credit card and gave us the keys. Never made eye contact. I hope to find another nearby hotel for the next time we visit the hospitals.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible beds and friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: MIew
Reviews.Content: I highly recommand this hotel!! I went to Boston for a quick week-end getaway with 3 friends. We had room 846, double queen bed. We take the T and the longwood station is only 5 minutes away from the hotel. It is close to 4 medical centers and a university of medicine too. It maybe not located in a touristic area, but using the T is very easy! Also, there's a 24/24 grocery store a corner away the hotel, the chic Burton's grill for incredible sea product, a food court beneath the hotel and it is a very safe place. The check-in went very smoothly, Giselle(pronoune Geez-Aisle) was a fantastic receptionist! Very friendly, a nice and warm welcoming from her! She also told me I was lucky not to bring my car for the parking :P Finally.... the room! It is not a very trendy hotel, but everything was clean and fresh. The beds were amazing, it was so comfortable that I regret booking only one night. I would recommend you to bring your own shampoo and soap if you have a sensitive skin. Also, the waterpression could have been stronger in the shower. But it is very bearable, I was being picky for the shower.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay in Boston”
Reviews.Author: ballen7426
Reviews.Content: I'm always a little apprehensive booking a Best Western property because they are not consistently good. However, booked into the Best Western Boston Inn at Longwood Medical because I needed a place to stay in Boston close to Boston University where we were getting our son settled. It was a great find. The check-in went very smoothly, and to our surprise, we were upgraded to a very large room. David, on the desk when we checked in, was very helpful. The hotel was clean and in good repair. Although we did not eat there, the associated restaurant had a nice looking menu, and the prices appeared reasonable for a big city. A particularly good deal was the food court right next door which appears to primarily serve the medical community as this inn is located right between about four different hospitals and clinics. The T stop was only about a 5-7 minute walk away-a very desireable feature in Boston. After checking out of the hotel, we realized we had left my wife's camera in the room. We called and left a message with the head of housekeeping. Later in the day, he called us personally to say that he had found the camera and would send it to us. The only negative we had was that the room could use a little more light. Would I stay here again? You bet!

Reviews.Title: “great place to see a ball game”
Reviews.Author: larry146
Reviews.Content: My son and I stayed here to see a Red Sox game. It was quiet and pleasant. Nice part of Boston near Brookline. The beds were luxurious. The rooms were recently redone. A fast food court was next to the hotel and my son was happy at every meal. The staff all were helpful and genuinely interested in our having a good time. They called a taxi to go to the game and showed us how we could walk home. Parking was convenient. This is our home away from home in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “It was an experience that will always be remembered.”
Reviews.Author: Bishopfdrj
Reviews.Content: Mr. Williams Davies, Director of Rooms was very helpful in giving us directions to two different hospitals. We are so greatful for his kindness to take the time to help us with this matter. We live in Maine which is much different then Boston. We want to thank him for his assistance. It's employees like Mr. Davies that builds a business like yours. God Bless, Rev. Franklin Randall

Reviews.Title: “PARKING IS TERRIBLE”
Reviews.Author: Puckerbrush
Reviews.Content: This hotel is FABULOUS for proximity to the many medical buildings/hospitals in the area. BUT (wish I could bold that word,) there should be SOME sort of information or disclaimer about the parking situation. Upon making a reservation someone should inform you of the situation. I know it is downtown Boston and parking is a commodity but SERIOUSLY. It is a parking garage (with a 6'3" clearance so hope you drive a small car) which is $18 a day. The parking was not well marked (as small Best Western symbol so we passed it,) the spots were TINY, the garage was SCARY and there was NO ELEVATOR! So if you parked up three or four levels you had to go back down the same way the cars are zooming up?! I was traveling with several others including a baby so we had a large SUV and I don't know how we fit that sucker in there. Our antenna scraped on all the concrete supports. The parking attendants were nearly impossible to understand and rude beyond belief. There is NO PLACE TO STOP AND UNLOAD YOUR CAR. You can get help inside with a luggage cart but seriously! The room was OK. We had two refrigerators, two microwaves (I'm assuming one of each didn't work) and there were missing handles on the drawers and dresser. The TV was such poor quality that when we ordered a movie you had a hard time telling what color things were b/c of the distortion. There was a black curly hair in our shower. Ew. The price was CRAZY for what we got. However, it is truly the closest place to the hospitals and medical buildings. Just know what you are getting yourself into with parking, cleanliness, service and cost of rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Thank you for being there!”
Reviews.Author: kenwilli
Reviews.Content: We have been very fortunate to have the Best Western at Longwood Medical Center so close and convenient to Dana Farber Cancer Institute and Brigham and Women's Hospitals. Our son had cancer surgery there and now follow up visits every six months bring us back to The Inn at Longwood. Our most recent visit revealed lots of upgrades. New flat screen televisions with movies service. Ice cold air conditioning and great water pressure with new shower heads, all excellent. The convenience of this hotel to the hospital can't be better. You can literally walk to the hospitals and about a dozen eateries without going outside. So thanks again for being there.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service!”
Reviews.Author: willworkforhotelroom
Reviews.Content: The Inn @ Longwood is conveniently located next to the Harvard Medical Area--near the Med School, the Dental school, the School of Public Health, near Dana-Farber, and near Beth-Israel. The rooms were quite comfortable and the staff was very accommodating. They were quick at hailing cabs for the guests. The Longwood Galleria is attached to the hotel, which makes it convenient to get breakfast and dinner quickly and affordably [considering Boston prices]. Toiletries aren't that great [I expected better from Best Western] but the bathroom and shower were wonderful. Room includes microwave, fridge, iron, hair dryer and free Wi-fi. There is an in-house restaurant and room service, if so desired. There was a computer and printer on the first floor for guest use but I would have preferred a few more computers and printers so that everyone wouldn't have to wait for "the one." Obviously, be prepared to fork it out considering the great location of this hotel, but this is Boston after all :)

Reviews.Title: “worked for me”
Reviews.Author: Lorrie32
Reviews.Content: This is my 4th stay here, each time for my husband's hospitalization in Beth Israel (who initially suggested this hotel). Only once had a problem - broken "radiator" in the cold months; got in too late to make report but was offered a free night at a later time. Otherwise, using the facility 4 times says something good about the hotel; housekeeping staff extremely friendly & helpful, always leaving my room clean and neat & well supplied with my coffee makings. Front desk also extremely friendly & helpful; assisted me getting on line with PC in lobby, willing to work with me when an extended stay loomed in our future. Needless to say, room was comfortable, loved the bed and pillows (sank into a needed sleep each night. Obviously, being only 3 blocks from the hospital made BW an excellent choice for me (as did the nearness of the food gallerie.

Reviews.Title: “Not at all what they make themselves out to be”
Reviews.Author: morebang4urmoney
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a great location as my mom needed to go to Brigham & Women's Hospital for an orientation into the Lung Transplant Program. When I made the reservations we were told the rooms were handicapped accessible and that the parking would be free. I booked 2 rooms as we had 4 adults all women and needed 2 double beds. We got 1 double bed per room and had to go down to the front desk to ask for cots. We were treated rudely and when check out time came we were stalled by the parking attendents. We came from Vermont and needed to be at the hospital by 11am that morning. We were late for the appointment thanks to their rudeness.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay where they make you feel like family.”
Reviews.Author: Jtreed777
Reviews.Content: The Inn at Longwood is located in the center of Bostons finest medical facilities and just a few blocks from Fenway Park. The staff is very accommodating for my families needs. Every employee that I encountered went above and beyond for me and my family. They have a Galleria with several fast food choices and a restaurant as well. Staying at this hotel was a great experience and I would stay here again. The Inn at Longwood is so welcoming and such a nice friendly place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “The service at the Longwood was outstanding”
Reviews.Author: mollymccann
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice and convenient to the T stops. The staff was very friendly and most helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Service Beyond Expectation”
Reviews.Author: Phone334
Reviews.Content: We are staying due to my wife's operation at a nearby hospital. Due to the Boston Marathon this weekend, our ability to keep our room was in doubt as the hotel was fully booked. I wish to thank Bill Davies, Director of Rooms, for having found a conference room to adapt as a temporary bedroom so we didn't have to leave the hotel at an already stressful time for us. Thanks, Bill, for your compassion! Jeff W. Bangor, Maine

Reviews.Title: “Poor service and bathroom”
Reviews.Author: classicone
Reviews.Content: room small, bathroom not clean, sink & tub didn't drain. ancient place, not worth the price even with the medical rate. promised early check in....got in after 3pm which is normal check in time even though we came from over 5 hours away with a family member having surgery next door. great location everything else sucked. front desk very rude and unhelpful.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Convienent”
Reviews.Author: scarletfever79
Reviews.Content: Had to stay at this Best Western during a conference at a Univerity in the area. It provided me everyting I and my company associates needed.The rooms were good and clean ,walking distance to the conference ,food in restaurant was also good and affordable. The service was good ,especially Amy from the front desk, We will stay again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and location at a reasonable price.”
Reviews.Author: KikiMarie918
Reviews.Content: I recently stay at the Inn at Longwood Medical and the rooms are very clean and the staff are very accomodating. The Inn at Longwood Grille has great deals at the bar for appetizers and happy hour specials. I would have given it a 5 however the room was extremely cold and the heat was not functioning properly.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: MEmomMaine
Reviews.Content: The room was nice & clean. We stayed here 3 times last year for medical visits to Boston Children's Hospital. This is the best place we've found in Boston. The restaurant was overpriced for the little bit of food provided; we only went there once until we discovered the Food Court. We LOVE the food court. My daughter, 7 year old, was so excited to have multiple food choices - McDonalds, chinese, mexican, etc.. She loved having Dairy Queen, Dunkin Donuts, etc., plus an escalator to ride up. We're staying here again for our next visit this summer. It was handy to have CVS as well to purchase snacks & milk for bedtime and for return trip home.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good experience”
Reviews.Author: aucklandflower
Reviews.Content: This was a business stay for 2 nights. I arrived in the morning at around 7am, after catching a red-eye flight from the west coast. They said they had absolutely no room for me to check in early. I desperately needed a room to look presentable for the packed day. The reception staff kindly gave me keys to a 'store room'. It really helped me to start the day well. The hotel is quite old, in need of renovation. But it is clean and that's very important to me. I had the larger suite with a microwave etc. The room size was decent. Not much to speak of, but reasonable. I probably wouldn't have opted for the larger room myself, but it was organised for me. The internet for some reason only worked intermittently. Location was great as I had to be around the hospitals. The T line was only a short walk in either direction. Not much to eat around the hotel though.

Reviews.Title: “Trustworthy and supportive”
Reviews.Author: mdcmr09
Reviews.Content: While my daughter was hospitalized I stayed at the Inn at Longwood which is conveniently located near Boston CHildren's Hospital. The last day I was packing quickly and I left a valuable item in the room. I called the following day and the item had been responsibly checked into housekeeping and the supervisor handled the shipping (including insuring the item) promptly. It is nice to know that there are still a lot of honest people who want to do right by the customer.

Reviews.Title: “The direcotor of rooms listened to my needs and accomodated them!”
Reviews.Author: capesong
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed here before because of its proximity to the hospital where we had appointments. The ease and convenience made it a certainty we would stay here again. I have surgery coming up this month and had to reserve rooms for extended family. Bill, the Director of Rooms, was very patient in listening to my needs and went out of his way to accomodate us. I doubt we would have received this attention to our particular needs elsewhere. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Customer service above and beyond!”
Reviews.Author: nelarevlis
Reviews.Content: Due to surgery at Boston Children's Hospital, my family had reserved a suite for 10 nights at the Best Western Inn at Longwood Medical. Complications meant we needed an additional 13 nights. In the middle of those additional nights the hotel had two nights with 100%+ occupancy. My family would have to leave the hotel, find new accommodations, and move back when a room was available. I called customer service, who explained my dilemma to the Director of Rooms and a few minutes later our stay was extended for the additional days needed. This hotel is close to the major hospitals, colleges, and Fenway Park........I recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “Good "Lost and Found" Experience”
Reviews.Author: psych0502
Reviews.Content: Once home and unpacking my bag after a week's stay at the Inn, I realized that I'd left a personal item behind in my room. When I contacted the hotel, I was referred to Mr. Noah Gopin, the Housekeeping Supervisor, who handled the matter with courtesy and efficiency. My "lost" item was returned to me within a couple days of speaking with Mr. Gopin.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel disappoints on many levels”
Reviews.Author: FF184
Reviews.Content: I e-mailed a reservation 6 weeks in advance requesting a room with 2 beds. I phoned a couple of days prior to our arrival to confirm the reservation and request. Upon arrival (one hour after the 3 pm check in) was told there were no rooms with 2 beds! They offered to take about $15 off, which is the rate you would pay anyway! Also 2 comps in the restaurant for a "full american breakfast". The waitress at the restaurant told us (after we ordered) that the "full american breakfast) was pretty much coffee and toast. The room was very small, the pillows were like balls, the tv had several channels with a frozen picture and/or no sound. It was clean and located near Fenway Park-our weekend destination. Overall it was ok. However, I feel when a hotel cannot accomodate your only and most important request, nothing else really matters.

Reviews.Title: “The Inn employs an extraordinary pleasant and accommodating staff, you can expect clean upscale rooms at an affordable p”
Reviews.Author: chilinfla
Reviews.Content: The rooms are clean and comfortable. The staff is extremely accommodating this was most important to me as I had a short time to complete a large task. The concierges Ramon knew his way around Boston and never failed me when I needed recommendations on parking or a resource to provide a solution or solve a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Thanks for safeguarding my laptop!”
Reviews.Author: TRN77
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Best Western Longwood for business travel. I have stayed there several times now, and have always found the staff to be very courteous and helpful. The rooms are spacious and nicely laid out. This stay I left my laptop computer in the room and did not realize it until I was at the airport. I called the hotel and learned that they already had my laptop locked away and identified as mine. They kept it locked up until I could check my workplace procedures for appropriate return, and then shipped it back to me (only charging a modest $5 fee for all their efforts, which included packing up the computer and taking it to the UPS store). The housekeeping supervisor was exceptionally helpful throughout the whole process.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place To Stay!”
Reviews.Author: jett54
Reviews.Content: This is THE place to stay when in Boston. Close enough to BIDMC that my husband and I were able walk a very short distance for his 6 a.m. check-in for surgery. Conveniently for us , the Longwood Bar and Grill was very nice and just down a couple of flights from our room (15% discount0. We also ate in the Food Court a few times during our stay when we weren't feeling like being waited on by food server. Room was clean, cozy, reasonably quiet for the location, and we plan to return another time, hopefully under different circumstances. (Medical rate was an advantage.)

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: OrangeTwist
Reviews.Content: We stayed here because of its close proximity to medical facilities. However, it's very close to the green line of the T which takes you all over Boston. The room was clean and came with a refrigerator and microwave. We did not have a window to the outside, which was a huge drawback for me because I love the morning sun (The window looked out into a back hallway). Additionally, the air conditioner was right (meaning 6 in.) next to one of the beds, which is okay if someone likes it freezing and someone else does not. The bed was comfortable enough, though the comforters were showing wear. The water in the shower did have a habit of going from warm to hot and back to warm, which was, at most, annoying. I also had problems opening the door several times as you had to make sure it was closed exactly right. I did not have any problem accessing the wireless internet, I just called the front desk for the username and password. If you don't have a computer, there is a computer in the lobby for guests to use for free. It was disappointing that the hotel did not have any exercise facilities. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The food at Longwood Grille in the Hotel was generally good, though if you did not take the free continental breakfast (we only received a coupon for free breakfast for one out of 3 days), it was quite expensive. Lunch too was a bit overpriced, though dinner was reasonable and the servers were usually attentive. If I was coming to Boston for the sole purpose of sightseeing, I would probably stay in a more central location in Boston, but this place was great for my needs for this trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, good value”
Reviews.Author: rmdjr
Reviews.Content: I stay here periodicqally on my visits to Boston. staff is extremly professional and pleasant. Bill Davies , manager, also very willing to help with special requests. The staff remembers my name every time I check in. Located in heart of Medical district and walking distance to Fenway park. Last visit was to attend Red sox game. Bar and Grille offer good food and fair prices. RMD, Woodstock, CT

Reviews.Title: “We had a relaxing, enjoyable weekend at the Best Western in Boston.”
Reviews.Author: countrybumkins1
Reviews.Content: Would highly recommend staying at The Inn at Longwood Medical Center here in Boston. It was our first stay in Boston and what wonderful people to meet. We had orientation for our son at MCPHS right down the street and it was around 7:00 AM and way to early to check in. The parking attendants went above and beyond to make room for our car. If you have every tried to park in Boston it is nearly impossible. We were more than grateful for that service. Upon arriving later in the afternoon, the front desk associates greeted us with a smile and great conversation. The Concierge even went out of his way to look up the score of the Boston Red Sox's game that afternoon. The room was very clean and smelled great. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “A restful experience”
Reviews.Author: timetravel-13
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Best Western Longwood when my son was in the hospital for surgery. I was exhausted by the time I checked in - at almost 10pm. I was greeted with a smile and a friendly/professional young woman. The room was clean and surprisingly quiet for being in the heart of Boston's 5 hospitals and Fenway. When it came time to check out, another friendly staff member took care of everything and the concierge wished me a good day on my way out. I was pleasantly surprised....and would definitely stay again - a good spot when taking in a ball game!

Reviews.Title: “decent choice to fenway”
Reviews.Author: sstravels19
Reviews.Content: safe walk to Fenway and to the T cheap option for an overnight room was decent enough for a night stay parking reasonable food court next door nothing else close by for entertainment but we got around fine

Reviews.Title: “3 nights of hell-hole and then one night of liss”
Reviews.Author: Jim002
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately i was put in a room with the building's airconditioning plant situated right outside the windows (only a few feet away). This consists of a big box with 4 blower fan units on top. When on full they make a roaring sound, and the windows seemed to do little to stop the sound coming right into the room. If it was constant you could perhaps get used to it, as a constant background sound, but they kept turning on and off during the day and night according to the demands on the system, so I kept being woken up. I asked to be moved, and this was only managed on the fourth night of a four-night stay. Then - bliss! Apart from that, it is a good clean straightforward business hotel, with a very useful food court downstairs, and a coffee-maker in the room (meaning I could make my own breakfast). Great situation. So when I scored "rooms" low, this is the mark I'm giving it for the room I had on 3 of the 4 nights I was there. The recommendation below is made with this reservation in mind.

Reviews.Title: “The Management was extremely helpful with my stay after I booked at the wrong hotel!”
Reviews.Author: sstMaine
Reviews.Content: I made my reservations on line and apparently clicked on the wrong hotel. I have stayed at the Best Western Longwood many times and have always had a great experience. So, when I went to check in and found that I did not have reservations at this hotel I was upset with myself. The Manager on duty, I believe, David Gore is his name, found my reservation at a hotel down the road by calling around. He made sure that I was not charged for the other hotel. We enjoyed the stay at the Longwood Inn and I am extremely impressed by the way the manager went out of his way to help us. I highly recommend this hotel and the service they provide!!! Sandra T.

Reviews.Title: “Great location with convenient food options when traveling with a four -year old.”
Reviews.Author: allenprof
Reviews.Content: We stayed here because the grandson needed surgery at Boston Children's Hospital. We expected it to be noisy but it was quiet. The kitchenette suites allowed us to have and fix food if we chose not to go out to eat. Since we were there for 8 days, the existenceof a very clean self-serve laundramat ---albeit in on the 25 th floor of an adjacent appartment building---proved welcome to us and others needing to stay for some duration with family. When a light fixture needed service, the engineering department was there within 10 minutes of my call. In short, it did for us exactly what we needed and the help was quite attentive to our needs. Easy location to get elswhere to sight-see as well. I highly recommend it if you need to be in this part of the city .

Reviews.Title: “The Inn with HEART in Boston!”
Reviews.Author: niteowlpam
Reviews.Content: Recently our family had the pleasure to again stay at The Best Western Inn at Longwood Medical while our son was hospitalized in Boston. As usual, the rooms and beds were comfy and clean, staff supportive and friendly, and the location perfect (as well as the room rate reasonable for Boston). We have been traveling to Boston Children's for our son's complex heart condition for nearly 10 years now, but until recently we have not been fortunate enough to obtain reservations here during our stay. This hotel seemed to be very popular and availability limited. Once we experienced the Inn at Longwood, we began scheduling planned hospitalizations for our son around the hotel's room availability! We had found out first hand why it was so popular and didn't want to have to return to staying elsewhere. During our last two emergency hospital stays, the inn had no vacancies, but thanks to the caring management and staff we were finally able to get a room. The first time their desk clerk, Amy, (with the help of the manager, Bill Davies) managed to make a room available for us despite their being full to the brim. Then just last week we were again faced with the "no room at the inn" situation and about to give up. The manager, Bill Davies, went above and beyond when he heard of our predicament. We were just about to give up late at night (after checking back frequently during the day for availability) when he raced after us with the good news that there had been a cancellation and he had saved a room for us. It is so refreshing to find that there are still caring people out there who will help you when the chips are down. We will be returning to Boston and The Inn at Longwood again tomorrow for more medical treatment, and are thankful to have this refuge during times of struggle.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable and close to Fenway and Boston, worth the trip.”
Reviews.Author: wileybeast
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel many times for 3-4 times each year when seeing a Red Sox game. For Boston, this hotel is very affordable and close to Fenway and a nice walk to downtown Boston. The staff are always friendly and helpful. check in and check out are also hastle free. I would recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “We had an amazing time at the Inn at Longwood and the service was excellent.”
Reviews.Author: lsull17
Reviews.Content: So convenient to Fenway Park and other Boston hot spots. We had a great stay and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “the hotel staff went out of its way to make sure our family had rooms together.”
Reviews.Author: dalahesten
Reviews.Content: The thing I particularly appreciated about the Inn was the highly successful effort made by the room manager to make sure my family had rooms near eachother and that my aged parents would be close to - but not next to! - the elevator.
