In addition, the parking situation was ideal: one is charged only once a day, and one is free to come and go as many times a day as one likes at no additional charge. In Boston, this is worth its weight in gold! Thank you to the hotel staff for their outstanding efforts on behalf of my family!

Reviews.Title: “Check your Credit Card Statement”
Reviews.Author: stacilacy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Best Western while my daughter was at Children's Hospital. While it was very convient and close, the problem arose when after we left we checked our statement for our debit card and had been charged twice for that one night. Two weeks later we went back thinking it was a fluke and respecting that people make mistakes, and it happened a second time. Being out $250 for 48 hours while you have already been hit with unexspected medical charges and days out of work is just another burden to place on an already stressed family. As I am sure that it was not done on purpose, they need to pay more attention and offer an appology afterwards for the mistake. It took three phone calls to get the charge reversed and finally on the final call is when they offered an apology. Great location, but common mistakes put added stress on the families who do not need any more burdens. Have you checked you credit card statement? Next time we will use cash

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful People at the Inn”
Reviews.Author: JHSCliintonNY
Reviews.Content: I was staying at the Best Western because it was walking distance to the college where I was attending a commencement. I rushed out in the morning and forgot that I left my camcorder charger with spare battery in the wall outlet. I called as soon as I realized my error and was transferred to Housekeeping. The Housekeeping Supervisor personally took on the problem, located my valuable equipment and returned them to me at my home address in Upstate New York. FANTASTIC !!!!

Reviews.Title: “A comfortable room, friendly and warm staff- located in the heart of Harvard Medical School”
Reviews.Author: SalesExplorer
Reviews.Content: The Best Western at Longwood Medical is conveniently one block from three of Boston's top hospitals: Brigham and Women's Hospital, Children's Hospital of Boston, and Dana Farberr Cancer Center. There is a Galleria with a plethora of food options and shopping attached to the hotel and a 15 minute walk to Fenway Park to watch The Red Sox when in town.

Reviews.Title: “The best nights sleep ever!!”
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from this hotel a few days ago. Had a great time. Staff very friendly, hotel clean, food in The Grille restaurant amazing! Eat there for the 4 days we were there and food was fantastic each time. The beds are the most comfortable beds ever! We were all raving about them!! Would highly recommend this hotel for all age groups!!

Reviews.Title: “Great LOCATION, perfect for Fenway stay.”
Reviews.Author: kellyone
Reviews.Content: The staff was amazing, the location was perfect. Clean and friendly and affordable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Find in Boston--Inn at Longwood”
Reviews.Author: GoPhoenix
Reviews.Content: We had a great time in Boston. We had a group of friends in for a 40th birthday and had a great room in a fantastic location. The food court attached to the complex is awesome in addition to the Inn at Longwood restaurant. Check it out if you are going to Boston--it's the best value for the money by far!

Reviews.Title: “Quick, Friendly and efficient service”
Reviews.Author: MPB01036
Reviews.Content: Easy access to garage and hospitals. Connected to food court and restaurant, short walk to T and nice walk to Fenway. Close to many colleges.

Reviews.Title: “really enjoyed the stay”
Reviews.Author: crishnivo
Reviews.Content: Staff was extremely courious and helpful. gave great directions so i could make it to my destinations with no problems.

Reviews.Title: “Thank you for your help...”
Reviews.Author: spkspk
Reviews.Content: At the last minute, I had to stay overnight to attend to a sick friend at the hospital. The staff at the hotel were very accommodating and friendly and the suite was clean and made this tough time bearable. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Our Stay During a trip for Surgery”
Reviews.Author: teenfamily45ma
Reviews.Content: We are extremly thankful to the mamgement and staff at The Best Western, The Inn at Longwood Medical. My 15 year old son was having what we knew would be a relativly painful surgery on his foot. You cannot find out the time of your surgery until 3pm the day before surgey. This tactic really adds to the stress and preparation of the surgery. So, we reserved a room for the 8th and 9th of April not knowing when we'd arrive. Trying to keep our homelife as normal as possible we did not arrive until nearly 10 PM. We were greeted by very friendly staff, who told us were we could grab a snack once we settled in. Our room was very spacious and an L shape set up made my teenage son feel like he had his own space. I could not believe how comfortable and quiet the room was once we settled in. At first I thought the location and street sounds might add to my son's nervousness. But once inside the room with the curtins draw it was tranquil/ Of couse the best thing for my son was that there was high speed internet available so he remained in touch with friends right up until we left for pre-op. For my husband the best part was that the staff was accomodating by providing some items we left at home in our efforts to make sure our son was properly packed up. Tye hotel provided extra tooth brush add addtional soap (teenagers use a bottle all by themselves). The evening of the surgery my son and I stayed in the Hospital but my husband returned to the hotel. My Husband is 6foot 5 inches and after being cramped in a share room at Children's hospital with nurses and surgens and a gaggle of people in and out all day returning to the comfortable quiet room at the hotel was the ending to what we felt was a very successful day. Thanks so much for making check in and check out so easy We appreciated the ease of parking as well. When we have the other foot operated on we will gladly return to the Best Western, The Inn at LongwoodMedical.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: DoctorStevenSeaver
Reviews.Content: Last night my wife and I attended a retirement party at the Inn - what a great time. Food was amazing, staff were awesome, and the drinks were great. After a few too many we ended up needing a room - hotel management was able to arrange a room for us - they upgraded me because I mentioned I was a doctor over at Children's Hospital and they do a lot of business with Children's. Breakfast this morning was awesome as well in the restaurant. I'll be going back. Hidden jewel among hospitals in Boston!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: cat69NewHampshire
Reviews.Content: We loved it. The kids had a blast!!!!!!!!!!!!!! The play room for the kids was great. The location was perfect. The staff was top shelf. I would recommend ths hotel to everyone. The room was perfect. The beds were very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “No fly's on this place - Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: RonnyJman
Reviews.Content: Clean, friendly and comfortable. The staff was great and even directed us to events around the city. I wish all my stays were like this - will go back in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant and quality place”
Reviews.Author: NHSG
Reviews.Content: The Inn at Longwood is well placed, convenient for city amenities and facilities and offers a quality experience and good value for money. Close to Fenway Park and convenient for Boston (Logan) Airport, it is co-located with a shopping mall which also offers several options for dining as well as a wide variety of local restaurants and waterng holes. The staff are friendly and offer really good customer service. I thoroughly enjoyed my stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Fatastic staff”
Reviews.Author: Chaoss24
Reviews.Content: I stayed there from March 5 to 8. After I came back to my hometown I found that I left my stuff at the hotel room. I contacted the Best Western hotel and they replied I should directly contact the hotel where I stayed because there are lots of Best Western Hotels and also imformed me of contact information. I e-mailed and one of wonderful staff, Tony Arias, promptly replied to my message and take actions to make me get my missing stuff back. Even though the stuff is on its way to my place at the moment I'm pretty much sure that I'll get it soon. That's why I'm writing this review now. I feel really grateful to Mr. Arias for everything he did for me. One more thing to tell is every single staff who served me there was fantastic. I'd love to visit there again. I strongly recommend this hotel to future visitors!!

Reviews.Title: “Will never stay there again or recommend!!!”
Reviews.Author: beamdvm
Reviews.Content: This Inn does not have a fitness center..it is a block away, you take your room key and pay $10.00 a day to use, it is not at all kid friendly!, We asked the desk staff to call us a cab to the airport and he called a "friend" with a lincoln navigator with NO SHOCKS! He wanted 65.00! He only got 57.00 but that was way too much!, There were dirty panties hidden in the closet in our room, the water in the shower went from ice cold to scalding hot in seconds! The tile wall was separating in the shower where the corners connected, I could go on and on. It was really disappointing! We will return to Boston often but will not stay there!

Reviews.Title: “Supportive Staff”
Reviews.Author: WNNX
Reviews.Content: This Best Western in conveniently settled in between the medical center of Boston. It is within walking distance of all the hospitals in the area. The rooms were spartan yet sufficient. The bathroom was small by today's standards. Don't expect any extra amenities. However, the staff is excellent. They know that people staying at the hotel are stressed due to visiting relatives/friends in the nearby hospital so they do everything they can do help out. We had to check in a relative at 1 a.m. and they were very helpful about it. Make sure to ask for the complimentary breakfast coupon if you are staying there due to medical reasons. This hotel is expensive; however, you are paying for easy access to the hospitals.

Reviews.Title: “Love that Longwood”
Reviews.Author: AndoverSwimmer
Reviews.Content: As a holiday treat, we attended a concert at the Parades and decides to stay in town. We choose the Best Western Boston â€“ The Inn at Longwood Medical based on a recommendation from my brother who stayed there to run the Boston Marathon. Being a frequent traveler to other cities, I was pleasantly surprised by the large room, king size bed and mahogany furniture. The location is ideal for anyone wanting to catch a game at Fenway Park or staying in Boston for business. All of the staff was very cereous. We were greeted with a smile and had the room key in a minute. Room service was great. I arranged to have a bottle of wine with a cheese plate as a surprise. Everything was elegantly arranged for our arrival. The hotelâ€™s restraint is a hidden gem. Even during a busy holiday weekend there was almost no wait. We thoroughly enjoyed dinner. I highly recommend the planked salmon with a Harpoon IPA. My dateâ€™s steak tips were cooked to perfection. We donâ€™t have a dog, so I finished the steak tips. We enjoyed to room so much that we choose to have breakfast in bed. Room service soon arrived with a hardy breakfast of bacon and eggs with home fries. Just like my dad use to serve on Sunday mornings.

Reviews.Title: “Great Area in Boston”
Reviews.Author: jkstick
Reviews.Content: We had to take our son to Boston Children's Hospital and this hotel is extremely close by. The amenities of this hotel are great and accomodating especially after a long day in the hospital. The bar area was great, the food court attached had everything for somebodies taste and the hotel was close to the train, Fenway Park and tons of other neat attractions. At one point during our visit, the hotel had to shut down the water( not their fault however an inconvenience) and our A/C did not work the greatest. However the rooms were clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location to Local Hospitals”
Reviews.Author: Daphne418
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at the Inn at Longwood due to its close proximately to Brigham and Womenâ€™s Hospital. The hotel had a very convenient parking garage attached for $18 a night. You need to get your parking ticket validated by the hotel before leaving. The check in process was quick and we got to our room within 5 minutes. Overall the room and bathroom were clean and updated. However, the AC/Heat element-vent was dirty and old, was from the 1970s complete with dust and grime. (This grosses me out at any place) The room was very tight for 2 Queen beds â€“ so one bed was pushed up against the dirty AC thing. Less then desirable but oh wellâ€¦standard for most older hotels. We had dinner at the hotelâ€™s restaurant. The menu was diverse and all price ranges. The bartender made some good drinks for us. The waitress was EXTREMELY slowâ€¦but the food was good. There was a small food court with fast food and coffee shops and CVS. The hotel was quiet for a few hours sleep. The checkout process was quick and we were at the hospital within 10 minutes. Iâ€™d recommend this place if you are traveling from out of town or local and have an early morning appointment at one of the hospitals.

Reviews.Title: “Decent place - would recommend!”
Reviews.Author: CaitlinMeredith
Reviews.Content: This Best Western is nicer and cleaner than most Best Westerns. Initially, we had some trouble finding the lobby to check in, but only because we went in through the food court/CVS entrance. At the front desk, check in was hassle free, but the desk staff wasn't friendly at all. He mumbled something about our room having been given away, so we had gotten a free upgrade to an apartment suite. We were a little confused, but hey, it was a free upgrade. The apartments are in a separate part of the building from the hotel, and aren't bad really. The hallway once you exit the elevator is a little small and cheap looking, and there was a bag of linens (clean or dirty, I'm not sure) sitting in the hallway for the entire duration of our stay (granted, we did only stay one night). But, once you enter the apartment, it is cozy and simply decorated, and the kitchen is even outfitted with dishes and paper towels, etc. There were a few things I noticed which might bother some people, but didn't really bother me. One is that there were some noticeable holes in one of the walls which just need a little spackle. Another is that there was a teeny bit of mold/mildew in between the shower tiles, and the shower curtain could have been a little cleaner. Other than those small things, the apartment was nice, and clean enough. The hotel itself is only a 6 block walk from Fenway, and in the same building as a food court/CVS. Also, the Longwood restaurant on premises is actually pretty good, and not expensive. I would stay here again if I needed to be in the vicinity of Fenway or the hospitals.

Reviews.Title: “How Convenient and Clean”
Reviews.Author: snjsportsguy
Reviews.Content: The Best Western at Longwood was clean and convenient. It's location is close to public transportation which made getting around this great city quite simple. The hotel is located in the Gallery which had a wonderful food court. This made grabbing a quick bite for breakfast or a convenient lunch/dinner wonderful. Overall our stay at the Best Western at Longwood was excellent! I'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “No problems here”
Reviews.Author: msa176
Reviews.Content: Gotta say that I read these reviews after I made our reservation and I was a little concerned. However, I found the negative comments totally unfounded. Our room was clean and comfortable, the staff was friendly and very helpful, the parking was hassle free and very reasonable for overnight city parking, and it was an easy 15 minute walk to Fenway. The only down side that I could see is there is no nightlife in the immediate area. The onsite restaurant and bar are both good and the adjacent food court provide a quick and cheap meal option.

Reviews.Title: “Giives new meaning to the word "filthy"”
Reviews.Author: blondie859111
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Inn at Longwood Medical because of it's proximity to Dana Farber Cancer Center and Brighams and Woman's Hospital. I was somewhat hesitant because of the reviews here, but it is the closest hotel to the medical facilities so we booked. I was completely unprepared to the actual filth and dirt in the room. I wiped down the remote, the light switch, one doorknob and the heating/air conditioning dial, and the antibacterial wipe I was using was dark gray and black. Astounding. Then, we pulled down the sheets and found long black hair between the sheets. i lifted up the sheets to check the mattress pad, because of an earlier review I read involving bedbugs, and was so dismayed to see dirt and very short, very curly hair embedded in the mattress pad. Overall, the state of the room was disgusting. Staff was fine. Check-in/out was fine. Complimentary breakfast was fine. I just wish there was another hotel close by to have another option for overnight stays.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: pattersor3
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were in Boston during the weekend of July 15th. This was our first visit. We wanted to see so much in so little time. We had won tickets to two of the Red Sox games, but wanted to see as much of Boston as we could. Thanks to David Gore, our personal hotel travel agent, we did just that. He spent time to not only telling us about all of the great sites, but printed information that helped us achieve our goal while in Boston and in allowed us to visit Salem too. The hotel was in an excellent location toFenway Park and downtown Boston. You could say that thanks to David Gore and the staff my husband and I were staying at the next best thing to home. The rooms were great and the maid service was excellent. I loved the attached eateries located within the hotel. Everyone was friendly and willing to offer suggestions and help. I would rate this hotel with the hightest rating! If my husband and I return someday, I will book this same hotel. Sincerely, Regina Patterson

Reviews.Title: “Good, Bad, and the Ugly”
Reviews.Author: belyndaw
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel based on the photo and description on the hotel's own website. It was a bit misleading. The hotel is difficult to find, considering that it sits in and atop the Galleria (not a mall, despite the name) among several medical facilities and colleges. We passed it and had to turn around - a complicated proposition considering the volume of foot traffic in the area. The traffic signals are slow and pedestrians (mostly medical school students in a hurry) pretty much ignore them, creating a major driving hassle. We parked in the garage adjacent to the hotel, which costs $18/day. The spaces are small and some valet service also uses the garage - double parking all over the place, creating another headache. Front desk staff was minimal and we ended up waiting for our parking voucher every time we came and went. That's the "Bad." The Good? The room had a great layout and was spacious. It included a table, desk, microwave, fridge, sink (basically a small kitchenette), and a whole wall of windows. (The windows faced apartment windows, which was a bit disconcerting - imagine looking out and seeing a man changing his clothes in his bedroom not 50 feet away.) The location was great for walking - much to see and plenty of restaurants to choose from. As a matter of fact, the Galleria food court is literally an elevator ride away. There, we could choose from a variety of quick meals - Mexican, Chinese, american, subs, sushi, soup, coffee, smoothies, even Dairy Queen and McDonalds. The ugly? Unfortunately there was an ugly. The toilet was unstable and filled inconsistently. The shower never stopped dripping and had a slow (extremely slow) drain. My ten minute shower practically turned into a bath. The bathroom sink had a problem with uneven water pressure. The lighting in the room was inadequate - four lamps with dim bulbs did not provide enough light, and opening the curtains was not much help since the hotel is in the shadows of tall hospital buildings. The door was challenging to close and latch, and I found the single chain lock (no deadbolt) to be insufficient. On an odd note, the hotel has framed photography on display and for sale in the lobby, yet when we inquired about purchasing a piece (which was a fundraiser for the adjacent hospital, by the way), no one knew how to sell it to us. We left without the piece. Why display prices and post information about the fundraiser, and then be unable to sell the pieces? Disappointing. If I had someone in one of the nearby hospitals, this would be my hotel of choice. But otherwise, I won't be back.

Reviews.Title: “Not fancy ,but good”
Reviews.Author: ggleeson
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for the Boston Marathon.The price was allot better than the other Boston Hotels but not as close to town center.Staff was friendly and helpful,we felt welcomed there.The hotel had a special pasta dinner the night before the race and put out free snacks and coffee the morning of the race.Room was clean and worked for us,could use a little updating.Free internet was nice to have and restaurant and bar were good.Also had a food court next door for quick items.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Inn at Longwood Medical”
Reviews.Author: pirate81
Reviews.Content: I travel frequently with my work and the Inn at Longwood Medical offered a great location, friendly staff, spacious rooms and great service. I highly recommend if you are in the Boston area.

Reviews.Title: “Not a great place”
Reviews.Author: Dutch99
Reviews.Content: Not a great hotel. Quality of staff was uneven, often unfriendly. Room maintenance was poor: the door did not close properly, shower poor quality. Room somewhat cramped.

Reviews.Title: “This place is a Keeper on my list”
Reviews.Author: jujunurse
Reviews.Content: Our child is having 5 different surgeries at the Childrens Hospital next door to this hotel this year. My husband and I think this hotel is great!!!!!!!!! :) Everyone there is courteous and so helpful. We enjoyed the variety of restaurants in the food court that is connected to the hotel especially when it was wet and cold outside. Also having a CVS inside the building was handy. We stayed in a suite which was nice, it had a fridge and sink and was little roomier. If your coming for vacation or unfortunately are spending time at the hospital next door then this is the place to stay. Keep there number handy, I do!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “medical discounts, parking tips”
Reviews.Author: joycandoit
Reviews.Content: PRICE: Discount when booking if you tell them you have a loved one at Childrens Hospital or Brighams & Womens--best discount Childrens Hosp@$149+tax. PARKING CAUTION !--be aware of how you will use parking! Indoor lot adjacent to Inn is very convenient & the lowest flat rate that can be obtained in area. HOWEVER, if you pay the Inn for parking there, you will pay $18/day-- but the garage itself only charges $17/day max (provided that you do not leave lot & return).ALSO, Inn stops your parking day at noon, no matter what time you checked in the day before, so you will have to pay extra cash to the garage if you leave after noon. For example, we stayed 3 nights--parked in the garage for 70 hours without moving car because we walked 1 block back and forth to the hospital. Inn charged us $18x3=$54, but garage charged us another $10 cash for an hour and a half because we left at 1:30p. Total $64. If we had paid the garage directly for all of it instead of paying the Inn, the garage would have only charged us for 70 hours, which is 3 flat-day-rates@$17=total $51, instead of $64 we paid. BUT, if you are going to be driving in and out of the garage while you are there, then paying the Inn is cheaper, because the Inn will give you a voucher each time you drive in and out, so that you only pay $18 a day while staying at the Inn, instead of paying the maximum to the garage each time you drive in and out (which would be very expensive). HOT WATER: The 1st and 2nd days, the water turned ice cold in the middle of my shower. It was about 8a, so I thought maybe the hot water had been used up in morning rush hour. The 3rd day I waited until midday, thinking the hot water would be recovered by then, but it was ice cold all morning. So it was impossible to take a hot bath or even wash hands in warm water. OVERALL--it is generally expensive to stay in Boston, and you don't get much for your money, but if you need a clean, simple, reasonably priced place near the major medical center at Longwood, this Inn fits. Next door to Dana-Farber Cancer, Brigham/Womens, Childrens, Beth Israel & others, you can just keep the car parked & walk. FOOD: Inn's restaurant is open from 6a to midnight 7 days, which helps when you have to time-shift around medical emergencies. Restaurant staff was very friendly. Food attempted to be creative and interesting-- a lot of it is a little bit spicy if you are a no-pepper person, even the clam chowder has tabasco in it. But food was fresh and tasty. Staff gladly packed up meals to go and food and beverages for us to take to the room. Adjacent food court is open less hours than restaurant, but handy with McDonalds and the typical fast food. CLEANING: Inn's cleaning staff was also very friendly, but note that English is limited. AVAILABILITY: Inn fills up. When we had our medical emergency (son in an accident), online booking showed no availability. I called the Inn and they said they could get us that one night for sure. By the time we drove a few hours to get there, another night had opened up. Each day we checked with them to alert them whether we were looking for another night, so we were able to stay as many nights as we needed. On the other hand, every night we heard them turning people away, suggesting other hotels because they were full. A person can't plan ahead for a medical emergency, but if one comes up, call this Inn directly and get yourself into their system. As they told us, it is easier to cancel nights than to book them.

Reviews.Title: “Marginal hotel, poor value”
Reviews.Author: Blueyes1119
Reviews.Content: The only thing good about this hotel is its location if you have a loved one at one of the hospitals, as it is an easy walk to several major hospitals. We stayed the night before surgery for my partner at Brigham & Women's Hospital and was booked for four nights. I checked out after just one night. The room was tiny and cramped, desperately needed upgrading as it was worn and tired. I've seen dorm rooms from the 1960's that were better! I couldn't get the internet connection to work, we had to take the top off the toilet to make it stop running after every flush, and the cleaning was superficial, including the discovery of a soggy, moldy coffee packet in the coffeemaker. How dare this hotel charge $189 regular rate and $159 "special medical rate" for this room! Parking is an extra cost as well. I got a much cleaner, nicer room at the Boston Park Plaza for $119 per night and rode the "Green Line" train for the remainder of my stay. Other than a room, this hotel offers nothing one might seek for amenities. It is dreary! It is adjacent to the Longwood Galleria which has a decent restaurant but is otherwise a small food court like you see in a mall. Unless you absolutely want to or need to be at the hospitals, avoid this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Return trip to Boston”
Reviews.Author: LSUno1
Reviews.Content: We had an enjoyable stay at the Longwood Inn a couple of years ago, so upon returning on a business trip I stayed there again. I had no problems with the hotel at all. The room was clean and the staff made sure that all of my needs were met. Once again, my 3 day stay was a pleasant one. I feel comfortable in knowing that I will always have a place to call when I am planning another trip to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “The Inn at Longwood Met Our Needs”
Reviews.Author: GracieLakeshore
Reviews.Content: We were here for two nights with appointments in the area hospital.The hospital reccommended the hotel to us. The room was clean ,the staff friendly and the restaurant and bar had good food.If we have to come back we will stay here again.Free internet was a plus.

Reviews.Title: “Tremendous Service”
Reviews.Author: Malvernite
Reviews.Content: The friendly and helpful staff at this hotel went above and beyond the call of duty. Everyone pitched in to help when my car battery died, and manager Bill Davies saved me and got the car started. Thanks for the excellent service and extra assistance!

Reviews.Title: “Ripping Off The Medical Community and its Patients - Stay Away!”
Reviews.Author: rain_song1
Reviews.Content: Please note before reading this review that I have stayed at this hotel at least four times in the past year, but this last time, was for sure, "the last." The front desk staff, including the hotel manager, is rude; they don't give correct information at times; and they don't communicate information when changing shifts. The night we arrived the hotel's entire computer system crashed. We were told, not asked, to wait in the lobby for over an hour with a 14-mo. old. The hotel manager offered that they have no emergency plan for this type of problem since it never happened before... After an hour we approached the desk and were told that the computer was up, but they still couldn't make key cards. We waited again for the engineer to come and let us into the room. For 5 mins., he tried to open our room using a long wire that he put under the door to hook the door handle on the other side. Yikes! The rug was terribly filthy since after 30 mins. of crawling around, my son's clean outfit was black, not brown, from the filth. There was an industrial fan on the floor in the hallway outside our room. It seems as though there had been a flood in our room since the ceiling was cracked and poorly repaired in the corner. Perhaps this explains the filthy carpet and hallway fan?! On a prior visit, the heater didn't work. The engineer came to fix it, and there was a disgusting old baby bottle in there, along with actual piles of dust that came out. The last time we were at this hotel, we vowed never to come again, but since Children's was paying for the stay, we didn't want to "look a gift horse in the mouth." We now feel that we'd rather drive to the hospital from a decent hotel across town, than stay at a "one-star motel" like this again. The hotel has a prime location, no doubt, with many of the hospitals right there. I feel they are ripping off the medical community and its patients since they are the only hotel in this area. It doesn't seem as though they are putting any money back into the hotel for upkeep, modernization, or cleaning.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay for access to Children's Hospital Boston”
Reviews.Author: MinnesotaMOMMY19
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Boston, MA, having stayed at this hotel for 10 days. Our son underwent surgery at Children's Hospital Boston and we needed accomodations near the facility. The hotel is less than one block away from the hospital, and within walking distance to many other attractions as well as the public transportation system. It is about a $30 cab ride from Logan International Airport. The front desk was kind enough to realize the length of our stay, and gave us a VERY spacious room along with complimentary crib for my son. With the exception of frequent ambulances (which can't be helped), the room was very quiet. Housekeeping was fantastic. The hotel is also conveniently attached to a mall food court, so we had easy access to multiple take-out options. There is a CVS pharmacy within the complex which was very convenient. The hotel offers an exceptional children's hospital rate, and then also reduced the rate because we had an extended stay. If we need to return for further medical care, we will certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Totaly Awful”
Reviews.Author: SimonHunter
Reviews.Content: Myself and a friend specifically booked a room with 2 beds. When we arrived we were informed that none were available and that they had put us into a room with a single queen sized bed. This, considering we were two male friends travelling, was certainly not acceptable. The only option was to PAY for a fold-out cot to be wheeled into the room. The hotel is also connected to a hospital, so be prepared for sick people wandering the corridors and constant ambulance sirens outside your bedroom window during the night. Our room was also never cleaned, with dirty mugs and glasses being left unwashed for the entire stay. At the end of our stay we noticed a sign which read "if we can help with another stay at a best western please ask". It happened we were travelling down to New York so asked if they could find out availability in NYC at a best western. The concierge told us that he wasn't going to help us and to look up the number in a phone book and do it ourselves from the phone is our room. We were then billed for the calls. All in all, itâ€™s been one of the worst hotel experiences I have had and would heartily discourage anyone who is considering staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Stay”
Reviews.Author: AliKay1
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a four night stay at The Inn. We really enjoyed the large room and the way housekeeping kept it looking wonderful during our stay. After a long day of sightseeing we knew that we would be coming back to a clean and well tocked room. We were delighted that it was close to the T and tat there were places to eat right there. The room service was great too. There were no problems with checking in or out and the staff was incredably nice. It is defintaly somewhere we would stay again.

HotelInfo.Name: BEST WESTERN PLUS Boston - The Inn at Longwood Medical
HotelInfo.Address: 342 Longwood Avenue, Boston, MA 02115
